page.title: 11Interview _ Mr Ashmole
page.content: An interview with{Sidney Ashmole}aged 65 by Cathy Bellamy. Sixty years ago the{transport}was mostly pushbikes because people couldn't afford cars. Maybe pushbikes didn't go very fast but at least it was much better than walking. In the 1920's the{shops}were a dull brown colour with the name painted across the top of the shop.Sixty years ago there were clothes shops in the village.There was a butchers,and a general stores in the village which sold everything,a post office,a cobbler,and a blacksmiths.The reason there were so many shops was because there was no transport so that it was difficult to get into the town. The{old school}up in the village was a tall,dull building which had two great open doors at the front.The old school had a great,big open fire at
